content.description: Follow the obvious ramp over a small bulge at the ~8 foot mark.  Small gear protects this low crux, but it can be difficult to place and judge.  With the crux below you, run up the "juggified" ramp with ample protection.
content.protection: Light rack with small cams for the start.  Two coldshut anchors.
content.location: As you enter For Real Canyon, this route ascends the obvious low-angle ramp on the left.

content.description: This route has fun arete climbing on juggy patina.
content.protection: Light rack with the opportunity to sling chickenheads.  Two coldshut anchors.
content.location: As you enter For Real Canyon, there is a short slabby ramp on the left side.  This route climbs the arete formed by the right side of the ramp.

content.description: Climb some moderate terrain up to the start of the right arcing crack and the first bolt. Follow the crack until it peters out, clip the bolt, and crank the crux move to the next crack system. Keep your composure, and continue out the final overhang past one more bolt to the anchors. This has sustained and super fun climbing with good pro.
content.protection: 3 bolts plus smaller sized cams up to #2 Camalot range. A #4 Camalot is useful for the lower crack, but there are other options. There is a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
This is located at the back, left (west) wall of the For Real Canyon about 150' past "

In Your Face

". This is the Solarium Wall and has a nice ledge along the base to hang out. It gets early sun and is a good cold weather spot to climb. Super Nova is the obvious, right-arcing crack on the left side of the ledge.

POISON IVY ALERT! There is a massive bush of poison ivy around and below the ledge. It's not hard to avoid it, just a head's up.

content.description:
This route is hard face climbing.  Nuff said.  Just right of

For Real

.

Hands to wild steep wall. This route is challenging for the grade. As of  May 30th  2010 this route now has 2 bolts added. As you exit the crack out right, bolts protect the wild moves onto the ramp.  This is one of the best 5.10+/5.11- pitches around.  A must do now that the bolts make it sane.
content.protection: All the sizes - cams up to a #4, and small gear all the way down to small wires, plus 2 QDs.
content.location:
This is just right of

Futile

.

content.description: This has steep, hard, face climbing the whole way.
content.protection: A cam or two at the bottom then bolts.
content.location: Reality Check is the first face inside of the canyon's left side.

content.description:
The Real Deal is a sustained, face climbing testpiece that threads the needle between

Reality Check

and

Is This for Real?

Start with a fun boulder problem to gain the large ramp, then head out on the face. The initial moves are gymnastic, with off-balance reaches between sidepulls and underclings. There is a decent shake at mid-height before the crux. The crux involves miniscule, rounded edges with poorly located feet. You'll want crisp conditions!

The FA adhered pretty strictly to the bolt line, and the proposed grade reflects that. One could certainly find bigger holds by deviating into the crack feature out left at the crux.
content.location:
This is the second bolted route from the right, as you look at the Northeast wall of For Real Canyon between

Reality Check

and

Is This for Real?

content.description:
The start of the route begins to the right of "

Ramp o' Stone

" at the base of the obvious black, white and green water streak.  Climb past 3 bolts to the "pod" and prepare for the crux through the bulge.  Follow bolts up the white gator skin to a no hands rest.  The last bolt protects the exciting mantel move onto the ramp/bolted anchors.  Aesthetic line with great movement.
content.protection: 9 bolts + anchors/rap rings. All bolts were placed on lead.

content.description:
Same start as

So Wild

- hands in corner, stepping onto ramp and follows out right to angling headwall.

Climb jugs to an overhang at mouth of canyon. Start on right-leaning flake - pull over bulge to horns. Pass horizontal - go over roofs. Rap from

Is This For Real?

.
This is the dihedral on the left wall.  It is awesome for the grade.  Why do you suppose it got the name?
The opening moves on this route are stiff.  Great face climbing all the way to the chains.
content.protection: Cams- from a #1 Camalot down and a couple of wires mid-size. Locking 'biners on the first draw suggested.  Some long slings for rope drag will help.  Belay down low.
content.location:
This is on the upper ramp on the left side of canyon just past

Real Black Velvet

. Stand GENTLY on starting block, clip in, and now the business is IN YOUR FACE.

content.description: Climb splitter fingers with an arete to a steep headwall.
content.location: This ascends the obvious fingers crack next to an arete.

content.description: The Cooler is a deep, narrow slot that has excellent toprope finger cracks down inside. A short, casual, 5.8 hand crack leads to anchors that are directly above this slot.  When you need some cool shade -drop into the cooler and enjoy some really sweet fingers and face climbing. The belayer can sit above looking down as the climber comes up toward him or her. This is a great little spot.
content.protection: Toproped usually because of length and the wall behind your back.
content.location: The Cooler is at the top left side of the For Real Canyon. Walk toward the back and get onto a ledge system that travels under a long roof section. Follow to the top and find the slot.

content.description: Traverse to the black streak, and continue up the crack & face to the top of the wall. I thought this climbed better than it looks. It makes for a good, fun, warm-up route.
content.protection: 2 bolts plus gear to 3", 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
On the left side of the Solarium Wall, this shares a start with

Super Nova

.

climbs.name: Around the Corner aka Unf.. Real

content.description:
Mouth of canyon - start up hand crack and follow "Around the Corner". stop above

Reality Check

or continue to

Real Thing

anchors.
